Subject: Re: About the new scenario editor

Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

1)Despite rumors to the contary and after thinking about how much 
stuff I am already doing, I will not have time to work on this project 
that much.  The only thing I would want is aceess to an uncompiled 
version of the new scenario editor.  In fact, if possible I suggest we 
leave full access to uncompiled version for anyone who wants it.

2)I volunteer to be a tester.  If it is possible to crash the program, 
 I will find a way.

3)I would propose the new program be worked on in various versions, 
just to make it easier to test.

For example, 

version 1.0 would have basic functionality: ability to put objects on 
a grid, ability to resize a grid, etc.

version 1.1 would have smooth-out grid features.  It would also have a 
 basic find/search-and-replace/search-and-delete features for objects. 
 It would also allow you to find/search-and-replace specific tiles on 
the grid.  You would also be able to look up where a teleporter heads 
to in this version.

version 1.2 would have a full featured find/search and replace/search 
and delete feature for objects.
